org.wildfly.security.sasl.callback

Class DigestHashCallback

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.wildfly.security.sasl.callback.DigestHashCallback
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Callback

    public class DigestHashCallback
extends Object
implements Callback
    Callback to allow Digest mechanisms to request the pre-digested {username : realm : password} value instead of the plain text password.

    The benefit of this callback is that the server no longer needs to store the raw plain text password of the user.

    This Callback has accessor methods for both the raw byte[] of the hash and the hex encoded String of the hash, however only one format of the hash should actually be set - the Callback will convert to the other format should the get method be called.

    Author:
    Darran Lofthouse

    • Method Detail

      • getHash

        public byte[] getHash()
        Get the hash that has been set on this Callback.

        If a Hex encoded hash has been it will be converted to the raw byte[] representation.

        Returns:
        the raw byte[] of the hash or null if no hash has been set.

      • getHexHash

        public String getHexHash()
        Get the hex encoded form of the hash set on this Callback.

        If a raw hash has been set it will be hex encoded before being returned.

        Returns:
        the hex encoded hash or null if no hash has been set.

      • setHash

        public void setHash(byte[] hash)
        Sets the raw byte[] hash.

        If a hex encoded hash has been set it will be cleared.

        Parameters:
        hash - - the raw byte[] hash.

      • setHexHash

        public void setHexHash(String hexHash)
        Sets the hex encoded form of a hash.

        If a raw hash has been set it will be cleared.

        Parameters:
        hexHash - - the hex encoded hash.
